result.execSummary:
The defendant Ruben J Riojas was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case. One or more other charges in this case were dismissed. The dismissed charges were not proven and have no legal effect. Ruben J Riojas is presumed innocent of the dismissed charges.

  • Ruben J Riojas was found guilty of Endangering Safety by use of Dangerous Weapon While Intoxicated, a class A misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 941.20(1)(b).

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

charges.descr: Endangering Safety by use of Dangerous Weapon While Intoxicated

result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. Ruben J Riojas

records.descr: Records of prosec. are converted data. See file.

records.addlTxt: NSF EF reminder notice mailed.  Administrative stay allowing defendant until 4/6/16 to pay fine and costs, granted.  sb

Petitioner appeared in court with attorney Christy M Hall.  City of Oak Creek appear by Assistant City Attorney Melissa L Karls.  Deputy Court Clerk:  ssm
Hearing on petition of return of property proceeded.  Arguments heard.  Court grants petition.  Filed, signed Order.
Letter stating service on City Atty/Oak Creek.
Return of property hearing at 02-03-2016 08:30 am

Defendant Ruben J Riojas in court with attorney Christy M Hall.  Daniel J. Gabler appeared for the State of Wisconsin with student intern Lauren Madente.  Deputy Court Clerk ssm.

AS TO COUNT 1:  Pursuant to plea negotiations and on motion of the State, Court ordered count dismissed.

AS TO COUNT 2:  Defendant changes his plea to GUILTY.  Defendant examined as to his plea, advised of his Constitutional rights and the maximum penalty.   Defendant advised that if not a United States Citizen, deportation is possible.  Court found that defendant knowingly, voluntarily and intelligently waived his rights.  Guilty Plea Questionnaire/Waiver of Rights and Addendum received and filed.  Parties stipulate to the complaint as a factual basis to sustain defendant's plea.  Court found defendant guilty and ordered a Judgment of Conviction be entered on the record.  

Sentencing proceeded.  Statements by the State, defense and defendant.  Court ordered defendant to pay a FINE of $100.00 PLUS ALL COSTS and SURCHARGES by 03-21-2016 or, as a penalty if not paid, convert to a civil judgment.  Court holds defense motion for return of property under advisement until the proper paperwork is filed.
Notice of Right to Seek Postconviction Relief received and filed.
Clerk received call from attorney Christy Hall advising that the State has not file a response.  The September 23, 2015 status date is removed from the calendar.
Received and Filed, Defendant's Motion to Dismiss due to Vagueness of the Statutory Regimes Related to Carrying a Concealed Weapon and the Safe Transport Statute.

Defendant Ruben J Riojas in court with attorney Christy M Hall.  Joy Hammond appeared for the State of Wisconsin. CMC. Defense filed motion with the Court. Defense requests a Status Conference and Motion Hearing date. Court grants defense request. State is to reply to defense motion by 9/24/2015. Case adjourned to branch 24.  Status conference scheduled for September 23, 2015 at 08:30 am.  Motion hearing scheduled for December 21, 2015 at 10:00 am.

Defendant Ruben J Riojas in court with attorney Christy M Hall.  Daniel J. Gabler appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Deputy Court Clerk ssm.  Defense counsel just received additional discovery and requested another pretrial date.  Court ordered case adjourned for plea/sentencing hearing in Branch 24.  Plea/sentencing hearing scheduled for August 25, 2015 at 08:30 am.

Defendant Ruben J Riojas in court with attorney Christy M Hall.  Alyssa M. Schaller appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
  Request for Substitution of Judge received and filed.  Court consented to substitution against Judge Siefert.  Parties are advised the Clerk of Circuit Court reassigned case pursuant to current court rules to Judge Protasiewicz, Br. 24.  Pre-trial conference scheduled for 06-17-2015 at 08:30 am.
Letter from Attorney Christy M. Hall filing a Notice of Retainer, Demand for Discovery, and Request for Substitution of Judge.

The Court ordered defendant to maintain ABSOLUTE SOBRIETY.
Court ordered no possession or use of any dangerous weapons or firearms.
Court advised defendant that failure to comply with conditions of bail may result in an additional charge of bail jumping.

Defendant Ruben J Riojas in court.  Patrick J Anderson appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  OCCR Tape#15-074
Defendant is advised that this case is assigned to Judge Siefert, Branch 47. Court reviewed the complaint and found probable cause.   Defendant received a copy of the complaint and was advised of right to counsel.   Defendant does not qualify for Public Defender representation.  Court entered a plea of not guilty on behalf of the Defendant. Court reserves Defendant's right to file a substitution of judge pursuant to Sec. 971.20 until Defendant's next scheduled court appearance.  Case is adjourned for a Pretrial Conference in Branch 47.  Pre-trial conference scheduled for May 20, 2015 at 08:30 am.
Defendant is Out-of-Custody. Court appearance in Out-Of-Custody Court, Room 221 Safety Building on 4/16/15 @ 1:30 pm
